ProcessGroup.Name: Manage Staff Recruitment
ProcessGroup.Objective: To describe the procedures involved in the recruitment of staff, both new and replacement.

ProcessLink.LinkedProcessName: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment
ProcessLink.Text: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment

ProcessLink.LinkedProcessName: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates
ProcessLink.Text: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates

Process.Name: Advertise Position
Process.Objective: To promote an identified vacancy within the business to effectively attract suitable candidates.|~||~|REVISED: John Doe, Human Resource Manager (5 Mar 2015)|~|APPROVED BY: Jane Doe, Human Resource Advisor/Executive Support (17 Feb 2011)

Task.Text: Discuss with the Department Manager position requirements of the position
Ascertain the qualifications, skills and experience required for the position
If there is an existing position description, validate it against the identified requirements and update as necessary
Undertake a final quality assurance process of the draft position description prior to advertising
Reconfirm with the Department Manager that the position description and salary is correct

Note.Text: What if a new staff position is being advertised?
Note.Attachment: You must ensure that the salary benchmark is set against the budgeted requirements and is approved by the Chief Financial Officer and Chief Executive.

Task.Text: Determine the most appropriate mediums to use

Note.Text: Which medium should be used?
Note.Attachment: Choose an advertising medium that is likely to attract the preferred type of candidate for the role in question.|~||~|Advertise on our council website.|~||~|Trade Me, Seek, and local newspapers are used for all advertisements. For medium to higher level jobs, the Local Government website (SOLGM) website will also be utilised.

Task.Text: In Word, draft and confirm advertisement with Manager

Note.Text: Where do I save the advertisement?
Note.Attachment: Save it under the Human Resources Administration: Recruitment and Selection using the container Recruitment Administration Advertising 20YY/YY. This is a secured container.

Task.Text: Prepare copy for the advertisement

Note.Text: Who are the preferred online recruitment suppliers?
Note.Attachment: We prefer to use seek.co.nz and/or trademe.co.nz for online recruitment.

Note.Text: Who are the preferred print suppliers?
Note.Attachment: We always advertise in the free local newspaper (XYZ Newspaper via ABC Advertising [contact details removed])

Task.Text: Send details of the advertisment to ABC Advertising with instructions for placement of advertisement
Once the advertisement has been mocked up and returned via email, check the proof and either approve or request changes
On acceptance of advertisement, provide purchase order number to agency

Activity.Text: Submit Details for Posting on Council's Website

Task.Text: Create an IS Request, attach the advertisement, job description and application form for the advertisement to be placed on the Council website

Note.Text: Is the Web Administrator here everyday?
Note.Attachment: No, generally he is here only Wednesdays and Fridays.

Activity.Text: Prepare Information Pack for Customer Services

Task.Text: Create 3 Packs made up of hard copies of the advertisement, position description and application form

Note.Text: What is the information pack used for?
Note.Attachment: When potential candidates approach the Council, a copy of the electronic documents can be emailed through.

Task.Text: Give the Information Packs to Customer Services Team Leader for distribution to other centres
Respond to any interest generated with an information pack (electronic, post or fax)
Advise Manager as applications are received
Collect responses together in a unique folder for the position
Respond to every application with a confirmation email

Note.Text: What if the person has not provided an email address, or the email bounces?
Note.Attachment: Check email address, otherwise respond in writing if no email address is supplied.

Task.Text: When close-off date has arrived, give the applications to the Manager for their review

Target.Target: Ensure at least five applicants are interviewed for each position within three weeks of advert going out.

Process.Name: Carry out interviews
Process.Objective: To ensure that all potential candidates follow a standardised interview process and to reduce the risk and staff turnover to
Process.Background: To ensure a fair and honest process to all candidates and subsequent employees to C

Input.HowUsed: to identify the best person for the vacancy

Activity.Text: [PROCESS LINK]: Review applications and shortlist interviewees

Task.Text: Send an appointment to each panel member's calendar
Call applicants and invite to attend an interview
Book a meeting room
Confirm the interview by e-mail
Inform CDO's of any external candidates and the times due
Confirm with the panel who will be asking what question during the interview
Prepare an interview pack for each panel member containing a timetable, set of interview questions per candidate and a copy of their CV
Each person on the panel should take notes as appropriate.

Note.Text: Things to remember when taking notes
Note.Attachment: Be aware that an applicant can ask to see these notes if they wish

Task.Text: Give each answer a score on each persons interview and add up to reach a total. The highest score is the successful applicant.

Activity.Text: [PROCESS LINK]: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates

Output.Output: Questions answered on verification of candidate

LinkedStakeholder.Link: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates

Process.Name: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates
Process.Objective: To ensure that all potential candidates follow a standardised recruitment process, that any specific areas of an individual's past needs clarification and to review the individual's 'council fit' using its values and visions before an offer of employment is made.
Process.Background: To check employment history and work behaviour's of short listed candidates to reduce risk of employing the wrong people

Trigger.Trigger: Shortlisted candidates identified through the recruitment process

Activity.Text: Request applicants approval to call referees

Task.Text: Contact applicant and confirm that they are happy for you to contact referees

Note.Text: Who do you carry out reference checks on?
Note.Attachment: We only carry out reference checks on candidates who are successful in the first step of the selection process and who the recruiting manager is seriously considering as the suitable candidate.

Task.Text: Contact the applicant's last manager.
Contact a manager or colleague from a recent position.
Complete the reference check form whilst on the phone with the referee (or e-mail the form if they cannot do the check straight away)
[FORM]: Telephone Reference Check Form.x

Activity.Text: Give the completed form to HR Advisor

Task.Text: Discuss the outcome of the reference checks as appropriate.

Activity.Text: Place completed reference check with applicant's interview notes

Task.Text: Consider the scores from the short-listing grid, interview scores and referee feedback and make a decision on who is the best candidate

Output.HowUsed: Used to assist in the decision making process to identify the suitable candidate

Target.Measure: Each person who is offered employment at WDC has had a reference check

Process.Name: Induction Week
Process.Objective: Successful and planned week one introduction of a new staff member

Task.Text: At the pre-allotted time the assigned mentor will meet the new staff member at the reception area
Tour of the building introducing to staff in at work that day
Take to their manager for introductions to team
Set up desk top support with IT
Meet with IT Projects to set up with building access, both with key tag, alarm system and security protocol
Meet with Human Resource Manager
Meet with Payroll Administrator to establish payroll requirements
Morning tea with team
Follow schedule in Calendar

Process.Name: Make offer of employment
Process.Objective: To make an offer of employment to the successful candidate of a recruitment process
Process.Background: Part of the recruitment process to secure a new member of staff to council

Input.Resource: GM approval of candidate for the position

ProcessLink.LinkedProcessName: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates
ProcessLink.Text: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates

Task.Text: Confirm performance % to be offered
Refer to Rumuneration Policy as required
[POLICY]: Remuneration Policy (under review).
Get GM authority to offer
Make sure they are ok to speak, congratulate them and tell them you would like to offer them the position and the remuneration details
Ask what date they would be able to commence employment

Note.Text: What if they do not know what date they can commence employment?
Note.Attachment: This does not matter at this stage, the offer letter can go out without this date confirmed, however the applicant should be asked to advise us of the date as soon as possible.

Task.Text: Send written offer of employment pack

Note.Text: What does an offer of employment pack contain?
Note.Attachment: A letter of offer|~|A copy of the Collective Agreement|~|An acceptance of the offer slip|~|A bank details form|~|A tax declaration form |~|A Kiwisaver pack including an opt out and deduction form |~|A personal health register

Task.Text: Add a diary note for 30 days to follow up on Collective Agreement
Return to the shortlist of candidates and review suitability of second choice
Review the % offered against the budget allocated
Get authority from GM
Discuss candidates attributes and match to the role.
Once an offer has been excepted, contact all the other applicants to let them know they have been unsuccessful
Tell Greg Tims who you have appointed and give feedback on the others that you interviewed

LinkedStakeholder.Link: Carry out reference checks for potential candidates

Process.Name: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment
Process.Objective: To obtain the best person to fit a job, which will contribute towards the effectiveness of C.|~|To protect council adhere to employment law through all recruitment. To ensure that all recruitment process are effective and suitable candidates are offered positions. To ensure that all communication throughout a recruitment process is a positive experience.
Process.Background: To attract potential employees who have the relevant skills, personal attributes, qualifications and experience to make a positive contribution at C. |~||~|To protect council whilst adhering to employment law through all recruitment. To ensure that all recruitment process are effective and suitable candidates are offered positions. To ensure that all communication throughout a recruitment process is a positive experience. |~||~|To ensure a standardised process is followed through council with the aim to successfully recruit good candidates who are a council fit and who will adhere to councils visions and values

Task.Text: Assess the position and person requirements

Note.Text: Why do we need to recruit?
Note.Attachment: Recruitment arises when a new position is established and/or a resigion is received.

Note.Text: If no requirement for recruitment?
Note.Attachment: End process

Note.Text: Is this a new position?
Note.Attachment: Business case developed by manager and approved by ET|~|Job sizing process

Task.Text: Create, update or review position description with the Manager / Team Leader. Check Delegations Manual for appropriate delegations and include this in the position description
[FORM]: warrants and delegations template.x
[FORM]: Position Description template generic.
[FORM]: Position Description Manager Template.
Send completed warrant and delegations form to the District Plan Administrator

Activity.Text: Complete business case for new positions

Task.Text: Complete business case template
[FORM]: Staff Resource Business Case Template.x
Obtain approval from ET

Activity.Text: [CONDITIONAL PROCESS LINK]: Manage Request for Job Sizing

Task.Text: Complete approval to recruit form and obtain approval from GM and CE before recruitment commences
[FORM]: Approval to Recruit Form.x

Note.Text: Is approval required?
Note.Attachment: Yes - approval is required for all positions at Council.

Task.Text: Complete a recruitment plan to confirm the source of advertising, timeline, interview dates, short-listing attributes and service levels
[FORM]: Recruitment Plan.x
Create advertisement
Advertise internally by e-mailing 'All staff'

Note.Text: Do we advertise all vacancies internally?
Note.Attachment: Yes, all vacancies will be advertised for at least 3 days

Task.Text: New Task
Advertise externally by e-mailing Find your Place

Note.Text: Do we advertise all vacancies externally?
Note.Attachment: No, only those positions authorised for external advertisement will be sent through Find your Place/G Timms.

Process.Name: Pre-Induction
Process.Objective: Setting up the Pre-Induction Process for new staff to [council name].|~||~|APPROVED BY: John Doe, Human Resource Manager (5 Mar 2015)

Task.Text: Ascertain induction needs for new staff member

Note.Text: What do we need to determine?
Note.Attachment: IT software requirements e.g. Authority access requirements.|~|IT hardware requirements.|~|Building access requirements.|~|Do they need a vehicle?|~|Driver training.|~|On the job training.|~|Bylaw training.|~|Council policies.|~|Payroll.|~|Health & Safety.|~|Civil Defence.|~|Do they need a warrant card?

Task.Text: Complete IT pre employment checklist

Note.Text: What is included on the IT checklist?
Note.Attachment: Start Date|~|Access requirements|~|Where they are sitting and in which building|~|Hardware required|~|TRIM security access|~|Software requirements

Task.Text: Establish first two week time frame for induction
Photocopy first page and provide to Records to set up personnel container in TRIM
Ascertain what personal protection equipment or uniform is required
Check with manager first as to expectations for first week
Contact BA to establish IT training requirements and timetables
Schedule time to meet CE and mayor
Contact identified teams and staff members to schedule times for any meetings or on-the-job training
Ensure timetable is saved into the employees container in TRIM
Confirm with manager that the timetable meets their expectations and requirements
In Outlook, book any meetings and training time in the appropriate staff members calendars
Confirm staff mentor

Output.HowUsed: New employee equipped to undertake role

Process.Name: Prepare for and Carry Out Staff Induction
Process.Objective: To ensure all new employees complete initial induction with relevant departments and complete all the relevant paperwork to ensure that they are signed on to the payroll.
Process.Background: To ensure all new employees complete initial induction with relevant departments and complete all the relevant paperwork to ensure that they are signed on to the payroll.

Task.Text: Ensure compliance with Induction Policy
[POLICY]: Induction Policy.
Email 'new staters' email address to advise key organisational contacts of a new starter

Note.Text: New Starters Email
Note.Attachment: Currently this comprises of one of the BA's (Chris Carter), Records Team Leader, IS Support Co-ordior, Quality Management Co-ordior, PA Service Delivery, Facilities Administrator, Management Accountants, Payroll, EDRMS Administrator, Executive Assistant and Asst Executive Assistant.

Task.Text: Email a calendar appointment to the Maintenance Administrator to organise Security Induction
Complete IS form and hands this to the IS Support Coordior and emails a calendar appointment tot he IS Support Coordior
[FORM]: New User Form IS.pdf
Complete Time Disciple Access form and emails this to Business Analyst (OPPS Team) and emails the Business Analyst a calendar appointment for training
[FORM]: Time Disciple - Staff Details.xlsx
Notify District Plan Administrator so that physical warrants can be created.

Note.Text: What is a warrant?
Note.Attachment: Refer to Warrants and Delegations template that has been filled in during approval to recruit process. This template would have been used to create the recruitment business case and position description.

Task.Text: Prepare induction timetable for first day
[FORM]: Induction Timetable.

Create induction pack for new starter - including Kiwisaver information, Southern Cross information, Social Club information, Our Plan booklet, ABC it Vaules, H&S information, Vitae informaiton, GSB information, Wai-ata, The Link
[FORM]: Kiwi Saver Deduction Form.pdf
[FORM]: KS10 Opt out kiwisaver form.pdf
[FORM]: Your Health & Safety [Email] .pptx
[FORM]: vision and values 2012.ppt
[INFORMATION]: OUR PLAN.pdf

Activity.Text: Carry out HR and Health & Safety Induction

Task.Text: Meet new starter on the first day and welcome them to Council.
Go through the induction pack
Ensure all relevant paperwork has been completed to add the new starter on to the payroll.

Activity.Text: [PROCESS LINK]: Induct New Staff - Security and Vehicles
Carry out Team and Role Induction

Task.Text: Introduce the new staff member to the rest of their team, explaining the role of each person and how they will interact with the new staff member
Meet with the new staff member and go through team specific details

Go through all Promapp processes that the new staff member is involved in:|~|- determine which processes (if any) the staff member will be either owner or expert of|~|- update the process ownership accordingly (or request the quality co-ordiors to update)|~|- determine which corporate wide processes the staff member needs an induction on (e.g. tender management, contract management, etc) and notify relevant process expert of need to carry out induction.
@todo - link in new 'process induction form' when completed

Note.Text: How do I know which processes the staff member is involved in?
Note.Attachment: The Promaster (quality co-ordiors) can provide a list of processes that each role is involved in.

Task.Text: Induct new staff member on their delegations (including warrants)

Note.Text: Where are these delegations found?
Note.Attachment: Refer to the delegations manual and position descriptions for those that are attributed to the position. The new starter should understand the various legislation and policys upon which the delegations have been granted. If new starter requires further training against these delegations these should be noted and carried out.

Task.Text: Plan training of legislation i.e. RMA, LGA if required.

Note.Text: TODO add link to training process

Task.Text: Determine what processes the new staff member needs to be aware of and which ones they need to receive training on. (TODO - add process induction checklist when completed - see Joan)
Ensure the staff member is booked in to other key inductions, such as time disciple, Promapp and ECM, as required.
Set a short term plan with the new starter so they are aware what they will be doing for the next week/couple of weeks
Discuss aspects of the position description and set their first set of goals, to be reviewed after a month
[FORM]: Goal setting form.

Output.Output: New employee completed initial induction process

Process.Name: Recruitment Approval Process
Process.Objective: To ensure planning approval for all recruitment of staff is undertaken.|~||~|APPROVED BY: John Doe, Human Resources Manager (9 Dec 2014)

Task.Text: Notified by the Manager for that team or by the CE
Print off the Position Approval Form for signing by CFO and CE
Check with CFO that funds are available for the new position
If notified by a Manager, confirm with CE and obtain sign-off for recruitment

Note.Text: What if the CE does not sign-off the recruitment?
Note.Attachment: Meet with the Manager requesting the position to inform them the CE has not signed-off the position.

Task.Text: Draft a job description for the new position
Ensure the Civil Defence Role is included in the job description
Print off the Position Approval Form for signing by CE
If notified by a Manager, confirm with CR and obtain sign-off for recruitment
Review the existing job description and update as required
Ensure the Civil Defence Role is included in the job description
If an existing role, identify when the position was last benchmarked
If outside of 9 months, have the position benchmarked
If job description or responsibilities have changed significantly, have benchmarked
If it is a new position, have benchmarked on approval of job description
Send the job decription to [name removed] to have benchmarked

Note.Text: How do I do this?
Note.Attachment: Via email to: [contact details removed]

Task.Text: Receive email from [name removed] providing the salary range for the position
Disseminate the job description and salary bracket and discuss with Manager

Output.HowUsed: To ensure job description and pay rate are approved

Process.Name: Review applications and shortlist interviewees
Process.Objective: To ensure that all candidates who apply for a position with DC are treated fairly and in confidence
Process.Background: Short-listing grid kept for all vacancies

ProcessLink.LinkedProcessName: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment
ProcessLink.Text: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment

Task.Text: Get key points from position description that describes what you are looking for in a successful candidate
[Form] Shortlisting Grid Example
Confirm interview panel
Confirm dates and times for interviews
Confirm interview questions
Go through each CV/Application form and give each individual a score against each item in the short-listing grid
Manager will shortlist all applications based upon the criteria in the short listing grid and also the ABC iT values. Applicants wil be scored accordingly and invited for an interview where required.
HR Advisor contacts short listed applicants via telephone and invites the candidate to interview.
HR Advisor confirms interview details with the candidate via email
Give Greg Tims a list of the unsuccessful candidates so they can let them know -
HR Advisor contacts any applicants who have applied directly to Council to advise them that they are unsuccessful for interview.

LinkedStakeholder.Link: Obtain approval for and plan recruitment

Process.Name: Select Candidate
Process.Objective: To interview and select an appropriate appointment from a pool of potential candidates.|~||~|REVISED: John Doe, Human Resource Manager (5 Mar 2015)|~|APPROVED BY: John Toe, Human Resource Advisor/Executive Support (17 Feb 2011)

Task.Text: Create a position skills checklist to use for reviewing the applications

Note.Text: What should be included in the checklist?
Note.Attachment: Questions to include:|~||~|1. Has the application been filled in completely and correctly?|~|2. Do they have the necessary skills and experience required?|~|3. Is the quality of the application cover letter appropriate?

Task.Text: Receive applications
After closing date of position, review the pool of applications
Complete a skills assessment against the position for every applicant
Score each applicant as to their suitability for the position
Identify the candidates suitable for interview
With the Department Manager, select and finalist the Interview Panel

Note.Text: Who should be part of the Interview Panel?
Note.Attachment: The Manager of the department, HR Manager and one other staff member who is without bias.

Task.Text: Pass the list and CVs to the Interview Panel to review and return with comments
Shortlist the candidates
With the panel members, plan the interview strategy process to be used
Design the interview assessment form to collate the required information for reviewing on completion of interviews
Contact suitable candidates to arrange suitable interview time

Note.Text: How many people can be present at an interview?
Note.Attachment: The HR Manager, relevant Manager and one without bias are the minimum number of people who can attend an interview, plus the candidate of course. However, in some cases where the candidate will be expected to perform a specialist function, it may be prudent to include a peer specialist to vett the candidates own expertise. This decision is at the discretion of the Manager after consultation with their team.

Note.Text: How long should I book for interviews?
Note.Attachment: One hour at maximum. Any longer becomes tiresome; any shorter and you may not have enough time to cover off all the necessary questions and material.

Task.Text: Prepare the Interview Room

Note.Text: What should be considered?
Note.Attachment: Providing water for candidates, ensuring the interview checklists are there, ensuring the correct number of seats are there.|~||~|Is the candidate required to give a presentation? If so, ensure the computer is set up correctly and ready to go.

Task.Text: Prepare an assessment sheet for each candidate and provide to each member of the panel
Once the interview is complete, provide the interviewee with police vett forms if required
Discuss the candidates interviewed
Compare against the checklists
Discuss with Customer Services staff as to candidate behaviour on arrival of interview
Shortlist down to 3 candidates and rank these 3 in order of preference for position
Advise via telephone the unsuccessful candidates outside of the top 3
Contact candidates referees to discuss character of candidates
If required, complete the criminal background check
If required, check academic qualifications with the institution
Ask HR Manager to prepare an offer letter
Phone candidate to offer position
Discuss with the Manager and Interview Panel, the results of the background checks on the top 3
Finalise on the ideal candidate
Contact the candidate and offer the position verbally
Contact the other two candidates and advise them of the results
Post or email (pdf) offer letter and accompanying materials to candidate

Note.Text: What is part of the offer letter?
Note.Attachment: Ensure you include that they bring their:|~||~|- KiwiSaver number|~|- IRD number|~|- Bank account number|~||~|In the letter, there should be:|~||~|- A copy of the collective employment contract|~|- A copy of their individual employment contract|~|- A copy of the position description|~|- Two copies of the acceptance letter, which they need to sign and return one copy beforehand

Task.Text: Receive the signed documentation from the candidate
In Word, run the IT Pre-Employment Form and complete all required fields
Give a copy to IT Projects, Department Manager and Records Manager

Activity.Text: [PROCESS LINK]: Create New Personnel Record and Position
[PROCESS LINK]: Create New Personnel Record for Existing Council Position

Process.Name: Set up new starter
Process.Objective: To set up a new starter in council
Process.Background: This process is to ensure that all relevant people are made aware of new starters in council. To ensure that payroll, Health & Safety, IT and security are included in setting up the staff member.

Trigger.Trigger: A person is offerred and accepts a position at WAIDC

Input.Resource: GM authority, exceptance in writing from candidate

Task.Text: Set up a folder under 'personal records' on the J Drive
Complete an IT access form online and send to Jaysal and Phil in IT
[FORM]: System Access Form
Send an email to to make them aware that we have a new starter starting at council

Note.Text: Who is in the new starters group?
Note.Attachment: The people in this email carry out an administrative task to ensure a successful induction for the new staff member, eg Time Disciple, Promapp training

Task.Text: Complete the Time Disciple form and send to
[FORM]: Time Disciple Setup Form - Staff Details.xlsx
Set up a folder including: Handbook, Welcome to , organisational structure, Corporate Plan, ABCit, Social Club, Health Register,
E-mail IT to arrange for the IT Induction on the staff members first day
E-mail Lisa in Facilities to arrange for a security Induction on the staff members first day
Prepare a timetable and send a copy to the new starters manager so they can prepare for the first day
Contact the new starter and explain the plan for the first day (e-mail the timetable if required)
Tell the CDOs that the new starter will be coming in
Meet with the new starter and go through the Induction Folder
Give the new starter the payroll form and ask them to complete it with their bank details as soon as possible
Take the new starter around council and introduce them to each team
Send the Executive Team an e-mail including a photo and brief description of the new starter
Outline expectations of the role
Provide organisational overview
Explain team objectives
Introduce new staff member to team and wider organisation
Once "new starters" form is complete, ask the relevant GM and CEO to sign and send down to payroll
[FORM]: NEW STARTER OR ADJUSTMENT TO PAYROLL FORM.X
Add a diary prompt in Outlook for 30 days
Add a diary prompt in Outlook for 3 months
Add a diary prompt in Outlook for 6 months
Prepare 30 day letter if the new starter has not confirmed what contract they want to be on
Meet with the new starter to see how they are doing
Check that the new starter has been given goals to work towards by their line manager
Meet with the new starter to see how they are doing
Check that the new starter has attended the Welcome to , Visions and Values and Health and Safety workshops.
Meet with the new starter to see how they are doing
If the new starter was referred to us by a staff member, follow the 'refer applicants to Council' process

Activity.Text: Refer applicants to Council Link Removed

Output.Output: New staff member is introduced into council
Output.HowUsed: Everyone in council is aware of new staff member and staff member is made to feel welcome

LinkedStakeholder.Link: Induct New Staff - Security and Vehicles
Set up new users in Time Disciple
